3. Mayor Katherine Ross

# Mayor Katherine Ross

**![Mayor Ross headshot_FINAL_20240104](https://www.snoqualmiewa.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=37501)Mayor Katherine Ross** **|**  **Term Expires:** 12/31/2025

For nearly two decades, Snoqualmie has been our home where we have had the honor of raising our twin daughters. From their first days of kindergarten to their graduation from Mount Si High School, this community has been an integral part of our family's journey. During this time, I’ve dedicated myself to giving back by volunteering in our schools, serving on city advisory committees, and serving on a local non-profit board in the Valley. These experiences, along with my professional background, have driven me to public service and inspired my decision to run for city council and mayor. 

Now in my fourth year as Mayor, with five years on City Council, two decades of community service, and nearly 20 years in business management – spanning supply chain management and internal audit – I am uniquely positioned to be a strong and effective leader for Snoqualmie. As Mayor, I am committed to ensuring a fiscally sustainable budget, maintaining the high-quality levels of service that our community deserves, and fostering a business-friendly environment. I will facilitate affordable housing solutions for our workforce and seniors, and actively pursue state and local funding for the community center expansion with an aquatic’s facility. Additionally, I will continue to advocate for critical infrastructure improvements, including the completion of the I-90/SR18 intersection and the widening of SR18 to Issaquah/Hobart Road.

I am honored to serve as your Mayor. I will take a balanced, pragmatic approach to every issue, ensuring that my decisions protect and preserve the heritage, culture, and lifestyle that makes our community unique.

### Service in 2025:

- Sound Cities Association (SCA) Board of Directors
- SCA Finance Committee
- Regional Transit Committee Member, SCA Representative
- King County Flood District Advisory Committee Member
- Snoqualmie Valley Government Association
- Southeast Area Legislative Transportation Coalition (SEAL-TC)
- SCA Mayors forums
- Snoqualmie Valley Mayors meeting

### Leadership

- Association of Washington Cities (AWC) Advanced Certificate of Municipal Leadership
- AWC Certificate of Municipal Leadership
